enum.disable: Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]

ConfigItem.Desc: 0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-10,000ms (in 50ms steps)
Specifies the number of times the sequence will repeat (unless superceded by another event) before it times out. When set to 0 the sequence will not time out. 0-255

The time between ramp steps to use. There are 16 ramping steps used to Dim on or off an LED. It is important to ensure that the (Dim time * 16) is less than the on time /off time for the ramp to complete. 0-255
How many flashes in the pattern - 0-15
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED A
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED B
If this bit is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not
Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when a filter is not applied
Event for which the pattern filter is defined.
Determines the type of filter to be applied when the filter is activated. Setting this value will specify which filter parameters will be used by the Sink for this filter.

enum.disable: Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]

ConfigItem.Desc: Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when the COLOUR filter is active.
Defines the filter that will be cancelled when this CANCEL filter becomes activated. The filter number - e.g. 'Filter 0' - will cancel the filter configured at row index 0 in this table.
Specifies the PIO that will be driven when either the OVERRIDE or FOLLOW filter is active. (This field is shared by both filter types).
Defines the time offset in ms between the original pattern flashes and FOLLOW filter pattern flashes, when it is active (in 50ms steps).
This field specifies the action to apply to the LED pattern when the SPEED filter is active.
The multiplier/divider to be applied to the LED pattern when the SPEED filter is active.
If this bit is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not.
Extended State ID
Event ID

Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_b LED pins)
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_c LED pins)

BuildVariant.HwVariant: CF376_CF212 QCC3021-AA_DEV-BRD-R2-AA QCC3031-AA_DEV-BRD-R2-AA QCC5120-AB_DEV-BRD-R2-AA QCC5126-AB_DEV-BRD-R2-AA QCC5127-AA_DEV-BRD-R2-AA QCC5127-AB_DEV-BRD-R2-AA

ConfigItem.Id: Override Filter LED is Permanently On
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set when displaying an override filter LED indication there will be no breaks in a solid colour display. Normal mode/event indications are suppressed for the LED chosen for the override LED filter.
This allows LED indicator patterns to be queued in the Sink.

ConfigItem.Id: LED Disable State Reset after Boot
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, after a reboot the LED enable/disable state is reset and the LEDs are enabled independently of the led_disable parameter. When cleared the LED enable/disable state is stored over a reboot.

When set The charger LED indications stay at trickle charge once reached, i.e. the indications only change when the charger is disconnected and reconnected. When cleared The charger indications toggles between fast and trickle charge indications as appropriate to the current state of the battery charge level.
Configures the PIO to drive when the LEDs are used.
Applies a scaling factor to the times used for all LED on and off times. It can be used to lengthen LED on and off times beyond that of the 2.5 second limit.
If LED is enabled.
